definition[0]: someone or something that is accepted because it seems good or harmless, but that is really intended to cause harm
example[0]: Senator Simon claimed the new law would reduce violence on TV, but opponents have attacked it as being a ‘Trojan Horse’ that would lead to censorship of TV programming.
definition[1]: something that looks attractive but that is intended to deceive
example[1]: The bank’s CEO described Japanese investments in the UK as a Trojan horse, destroying Europe’s defences against unfair competition.
definition[2]: a computer program that seems to be helpful but that is designed to destroy data
example[2]: Security was breached by a Trojan horse accidentally downloaded to a government computer.
